          Comment 42<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1290008#c42">Comment 42<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      majewski@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/3070416764" title="majewski@chromium.org"><!---->majewski@chromium.org<!----></a>
      majewski@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->majewski@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Feb 1, 2022, 4:45 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 1, 2022, 4:45 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1290008#c42">Comment 42<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 1, 2022, 4:45 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1290008#c42">Comment 42<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 1, 2022, 4:45 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        With regards to the above issues:<span class="line"><!---->With regards to the above issues:<!----></span><br><br>1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<span class="line"><!---->1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<span class="line"><!----> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<!----></span><br><br>2. No, as stated in point 1 the bug was present from the moment the feature was checked in, but it remained hidden behind the flag.<span class="line"><!---->2. No, as stated in point 1 the bug was present from the moment the feature was checked in, but it remained hidden behind the flag.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        The POC file and the reproduction video is attached.<span class="line"><!---->The POC file and the reproduction video is attached.<!----></span><br><br>The steps are:<span class="line"><!---->The steps are:<!----></span><br>1. open <span class="line"><!---->1. open <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8000/poc.html<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> click open button<span class="line"><!----> click open button<!----></span><br>2. the <span class="line"><!---->2. the <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8000/crash.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8000/crash.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8000/crash.html<!----></a> will pop up, click Trigger button. <span class="line"><!----> will pop up, click Trigger button. <!----></span><br>3. open Printing option and save the pdf file until the crash.html closed (about 10 seconds) as the video shows.<span class="line"><!---->3. open Printing option and save the pdf file until the crash.html closed (about 10 seconds) as the video shows.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 18<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1290008#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      happy...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1559702915" title="happy...@gmail.com"><!---->happy...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      happy...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->happy...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Sun, Jan 30, 2022, 12:22 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jan 30, 2022, 12:22 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1290008#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jan 30, 2022, 12:22 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1290008#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Jan 30, 2022, 12:22 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Analysis (probably not completely correct):<span class="line"><!---->Analysis (probably not completely correct):<!----></span><br><br>When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <span class="line"><!---->When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <!----></span><br><br>When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<span class="line"><!---->When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<span class="line"><!---->Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<!----></span><br><br>Patch suggestion:<span class="line"><!---->Patch suggestion:<!----></span><br>In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<span class="line"><!---->In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<!----></span><br><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<span class="line"><!---->Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        With regards to the above issues:<span class="line"><!---->With regards to the above issues:<!----></span><br><br>1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<span class="line"><!---->1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<span class="line"><!----> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<!----></span><br><br>2. No, as stated in point 1 the bug was present from the moment the feature was checked in, but it remained hidden behind the flag.<span class="line"><!---->2.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Sorry for the late reply. <span class="line"><!---->Sorry for the late reply. <!----></span><br><br>As thestig says, this issue could reproduce when the FilesSWA feature enabled. In M99, this feature enabled by default.<span class="line"><!---->As thestig says, this issue could reproduce when the FilesSWA feature enabled. In M99, this feature enabled by default.<!----></span><br><br>I could reproduce this UAF on M97 and M98 as well, when add `--enable-features=FilesSWA` flag.<span class="line"><!---->I could reproduce this UAF on M97 and M98 as well, when add `--enable-features=FilesSWA` flag.<!----></span><br><br>Test chromium version:<span class="line"><!---->Test chromium version:<!----></span><br>- Version 97.0.4692.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) <span class="line"><!---->- Version 97.0.4692.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) <!----></span><br>   linux-release-chromeos/asan-linux-release-938552.zip<span class="line"><!---->   linux-release-chromeos/asan-linux-release-938552.zip<!----></span><br>- Version 98.0.4758.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->- Version 98.0.4758.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>   linux-release-chromeos/asan-linux-release-950414.zip<span class="line"><!---->   linux-release-chromeos/asan-linux-release-950414.zip<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 18<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1290008#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1290008#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        Analysis (probably not completely correct):<span class="line"><!---->Analysis (probably not completely correct):<!----></span><br><br>When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <span class="line"><!---->When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <!----></span><br><br>When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<span class="line"><!---->When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<span class="line"><!---->Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<!----></span><br><br>Patch suggestion:<span class="line"><!---->Patch suggestion:<!----></span><br>In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<span class="line"><!---->In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<!----></span><br><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327<!----></a><br><br>  if (ash::features::IsFileManagerSwaEnabled()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (ash::features::IsFileManagerSwaEnabled()) {<!----></span><br>    // SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the // [4]<span class="line"><!---->    // SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the // [4]<!----></span><br>    // delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.<span class="line"><!---->    // delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.<!----></span><br>    // Hence this memory-leak looking code pattern.<span class="line"><!---->    // Hence this memory-leak looking code pattern.<!----></span><br>    auto* dialog_delegate = new SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate(<span class="line"><!---->    auto* dialog_delegate = new SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate(<!----></span><br>        this, routing_id, file_manager_url, dialog_title);         // [1]<span class="line"><!---->        this, routing_id, file_manager_url, dialog_title);         // [1]<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->SetModal(owner.window != nullptr);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;SetModal(owner.window != nullptr);<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->set_can_resize(can_resize_);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;set_can_resize(can_resize_);<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->ShowSystemDialogForBrowserContext(profile_, parent_window);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;ShowSystemDialogForBrowserContext(profile_, parent_window);<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266<!----></a><br><br>  // The parent of this delegate.<span class="line"><!---->  // The parent of this delegate.<!----></span><br>  SelectFileDialogExtension* parent_; // [2]<span class="line"><!---->  SelectFileDialogExtension* parent_; // [2]<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br><br>3. <span class="line"><!---->3. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=247<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=247"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=247<!----></a><br><br>  void OnDialogWillClose() override { parent_->OnSystemDialogWillClose(); } // [3] (<---- use parent_ pointer)<span class="line"><!---->  void OnDialogWillClose() override { parent_-&gt;OnSystemDialogWillClose(); } // [3] (&lt;---- use parent_ pointer)<!----></span><br><br><br>I've attached a UAF symbolized trace for easier identification (tested on commit fad861f65d7, version 99.0.4844.9).<span class="line"><!---->I've attached a UAF symbolized trace for easier identification (tested on commit fad861f65d7, version       <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-97 FoundIn-98
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<span class="line"><!---->Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        With regards to the above issues:<span class="line"><!---->With regards to the above issues:<!----></span><br><br>1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<span class="line"><!---->1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<span class="line"><!----> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<!----></span><br><br>2. No, as stated in point 1 the bug was present from the moment the feature was checked in, but it remained hidden behind the flag.<span class="line"><!---->2. No, as stated in point 1 the bug was present from the moment the feature was checked in, but it remained hidden behind the flag.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The POC file and the reproduction video is attached.<span class="line"><!---->The POC file and the reproduction video is attached.<!----></span><br><br>The steps are:<span class="line"><!---->The steps are:<!----></span><br>1. open <span class="line"><!---->1. open <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8000/poc.html<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> click open button<span class="line"><!----> click open button<!----></span><br>2. the <span class="line"><!---->2. the <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8000/crash.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8000/crash.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8000/crash.html<!----></a> will pop up, click Trigger button. <span class="line"><!----> will pop up, click Trigger button. <!----></span><br>3. open Printing option and save the pdf file until the crash.html closed (about 10 seconds) as the video shows.<span class="line"><!---->3. open Printing option and save the pdf file until the crash.html closed (about 10 seconds) as the video shows.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        Analysis (probably not completely correct):<span class="line"><!---->Analysis (probably not completely correct):<!----></span><br><br>When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <span class="line"><!---->When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <!----></span><br><br>When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<span class="line"><!---->When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<span class="line"><!---->Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<!----></span><br><br>Patch suggestion:<span class="line"><!---->Patch suggestion:<!----></span><br>In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<span class="line"><!---->In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<!----></span><br><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327<!----></a><br><br>  if (ash::features::IsFileManagerSwaEnabled()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (ash::features::IsFileManagerSwaEnabled()) {<!----></span><br>    // SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the // [4]<span class="line"><!---->    // SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the // [4]<!----></span><br>    // delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.<span class="line"><!---->    // delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.<!----></span><br>    // Hence this memory-leak looking code pattern.<span class="line"><!---->    // Hence this memory-leak looking code pattern.<!----></span><br>    auto* dialog_delegate = new SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate(<span class="line"><!---->    auto* dialog_delegate = new SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate(<!----></span><br>        this, routing_id, file_manager_url, dialog_title);         // [1]<span class="line"><!---->        this, routing_id, file_manager_url, dialog_title);         // [1]<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->SetModal(owner.window != nullptr);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;SetModal(owner.window != nullptr);<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->set_can_resize(can_resize_);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;set_can_resize(can_resize_);<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->ShowSystemDialogForBrowserContext(profile_, parent_window);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;ShowSystemDialogForBrowserContext(profile_, parent_window);<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266<!----></a><br><br> SelectFileDialogExtension* parent_; // [2]<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br><br>3. <span class="line"><!---->3.         Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<span class="line"><!---->Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        With regards to the above issues:<span class="line"><!---->With regards to the above issues:<!----></span><br><br>1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<span class="line"><!---->1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<span class="line"><!----> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<!----></span><br><br>2. No, as stated in point 1 the bug was present from the moment the feature was checked in, but it remained hidden behind the flag.<span class="line"><!---->2. No, as stated in point 1 the bug was present from the moment the feature was checked in, but it remained hidden behind the flag.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        Analysis (probably not completely correct):<span class="line"><!---->Analysis (probably not completely correct):<!----></span><br><br>When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <span class="line"><!---->When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <!----></span><br><br>When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<span class="line"><!---->When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<span class="line"><!---->Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<!----></span><br><br>Patch suggestion:<span class="line"><!---->Patch suggestion:<!----></span><br>In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<span class="line"><!---->In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<!----></span><br><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327<!----></a><br><br>  if (ash::features::IsFileManagerSwaEnabled()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (ash::features::IsFileManagerSwaEnabled()) {<!----></span><br>    // SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the // [4]<span class="line"><!---->    // SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the // [4]<!----></span><br>    // delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.<span class="line"><!---->    // delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.<!----></span><br>    // Hence this memory-leak looking code pattern.<span class="line"><!---->    // Hence this memory-leak looking code pattern.<!----></span><br>    auto* dialog_delegate = new SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate(<span class="line"><!---->    auto* dialog_delegate = new SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate(<!----></span><br>        this, routing_id, file_manager_url, dialog_title);         // [1]<span class="line"><!---->        this, routing_id, file_manager_url, dialog_title);         // [1]<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->SetModal(owner.window != nullptr);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;SetModal(owner.window != nullptr);<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->set_can_resize(can_resize_);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;set_can_resize(can_resize_);<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->ShowSystemDialogForBrowserContext(profile_, parent_window);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;ShowSystemDialogForBrowserContext(profile_, parent_window);<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266<!----></a><br><br>  // The parent of this delegate.<span class="line"><!---->  // The parent of this delegate.<!----></span><br>  SelectFileDialogExtension* parent_; // [2]<span class="line"><!---->  SelectFileDialogExtension* parent_; // [2]<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br><br>3. <span class="line"><!---->3. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=247<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=247"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=247<!----></a><br><br>  void OnDialogWillClose() override { parent_->OnSystemDialogWillClose(); } // [3] (<---- use parent_ pointer)<span class="line"><!---->  void OnDialogWillClose() override { parent_-&gt;OnSystemDialogWillClose(); } // [3] (&lt;---- use parent_ pointer)<!----></span><br><br><br>I've attached a UAF symbolized trace for easier identification (tested on commit fad861f65d7, version 99.0.4844.9).<span class="line"><!---->I've attached a UAF symbolized trace for easier identification (tested on commit fad861f65d7, version         Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<span class="line"><!---->Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<span class="line"><!----> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The POC file and the reproduction video is attached.<span class="line"><!---->The POC file and the reproduction video is attached.<!----></span><br><br>The steps are:<span class="line"><!---->The steps are:<!----></span><br>1. open <span class="line"><!---->1. open <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8000/poc.html<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> click open button<span class="line"><!----> click open button<!----></span><br>2. the <span class="line"><!---->2. the <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8000/crash.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8000/crash.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8000/crash.html<!----></a> will pop up, click Trigger button. <span class="line"><!----> will pop up, click Trigger button. <!----></span><br>3. open Printing option and save the pdf file until the crash.html closed (about 10 seconds) as the video shows.<span class="line"><!---->3. open Printing option and save the pdf file until the crash.html closed (about 10 seconds) as the video shows.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        Analysis (probably not completely correct):<span class="line"><!---->Analysis (probably not completely correct):<!----></span><br><br>When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <span class="line"><!---->When print the website as pdf (PdfPrinterHandler::PostPrintToPdfTask()), SelectFileDialogExtension created a SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate instance that provides notifications to SelectFileDialogExtension. In select_file_dialog_extension.cc, [1] passes `this` raw pointer to build a notifier as SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate (when FilesSWA feature is enabled, which is a default feature in M99). <!----></span><br><br>When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<span class="line"><!---->When the web contents destroyed, SelectFileDialogExtension destroyed as well. However, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate doesn't know at that time, the `parent_` pointer field (pointer to SelectFileDialogExtension) [2] has destroyed. Later when the dialog closed, SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate::OnDialogWillClose() still notify SelectFileDialogExtension without checking whether the SelectFileDialogExtension (i.e., parent_ pointer) is destroyed [3] ,  call the SelectFileDialogExtension::OnSystemDialogWillClose(), which causes the UAF.<!----></span><br><br><br>Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<span class="line"><!---->Note that the comment when create SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate in [4] writes `SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.` is actually not help because the life cycle of SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is not observed.<!----></span><br><br>Patch suggestion:<span class="line"><!---->Patch suggestion:<!----></span><br>In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<span class="line"><!---->In [1], pass `this` pointer as scoped_refptr or other smart pointer and check `parent_` validation before use in [3].<!----></span><br><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;l=542-546;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327<!----></a><br><br>  if (ash::features::IsFileManagerSwaEnabled()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (ash::features::IsFileManagerSwaEnabled()) {<!----></span><br>    // SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the // [4]<span class="line"><!---->    // SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate is a self-deleting class that calls the // [4]<!----></span><br>    // delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.<span class="line"><!---->    // delete operator once the dialog for which it was created has been closed.<!----></span><br>    // Hence this memory-leak looking code pattern.<span class="line"><!---->    // Hence this memory-leak looking code pattern.<!----></span><br>    auto* dialog_delegate = new SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate(<span class="line"><!---->    auto* dialog_delegate = new SystemFilesAppDialogDelegate(<!----></span><br>        this, routing_id, file_manager_url, dialog_title);         // [1]<span class="line"><!---->        this, routing_id, file_manager_url, dialog_title);         // [1]<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->SetModal(owner.window != nullptr);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;SetModal(owner.window != nullptr);<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->set_can_resize(can_resize_);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;set_can_resize(can_resize_);<!----></span><br>    dialog_delegate->ShowSystemDialogForBrowserContext(profile_, parent_window);<span class="line"><!---->    dialog_delegate-&gt;ShowSystemDialogForBrowserContext(profile_, parent_window);<!----></span><br><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/select_file_dialog_extension.cc;drc=d8d4e48b781de40bede4dd712877d9df862db327;l=266<!----></a><br><br> SelectFileDialogExtension* parent_; // [2]<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br><br>3. <span class="line"><!---->3.         Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<span class="line"><!---->Adding other affected versions (note, this vulnerability is only present when the user has the #files-swa feature flag enabled, which is currently true if they turned it on, or for the cohort of users in the experiment on M99 canary / dev and M98 beta channels).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        With regards to the above issues:<span class="line"><!---->With regards to the above issues:<!----></span><br><br>1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<span class="line"><!---->1. No, it was not a regression. The originally checked in code (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3065206<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<span class="line"><!----> contained a raw pointer, which is what was the root cause of this issue. As it was checked in on Aug 19, it was in the state that was discovered by this bug since M95. However, the bug manifests itself only when #files-swa feature flag enabled. By default the flag is disabled. It was recently enabled when we launched a finch experiment in the beta branch.<!----></span><br><br>2. No, as stated in point 1 the bug was present from the moment the feature was checked in, but it remained hidden behind the flag.<span class="line"><!---->2. No, as stated in point 1 the bug was present from the moment the feature was checked in, but it remained hidden behind the flag.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

        for LitElement.

window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
